item.title: 收益不佳，Baupost 客户自 2021 年以来撤资 70 亿美元
item.description: 塞斯-克拉曼（Seth Klarman）的 Baupost 集团的客户在过去三年中从该对冲基金撤资约 70 亿美元，在经历了十年的低迷回报后，他们对这位著名的价值投资者失去了耐心。【原文：Clients of Seth Klarman’s Baupost Group pulled roughly $7 billion from the hedge fund in the past three years, losing patience with the famed value investor after a decade of lackluster returns.】

item.title: 亚马逊将关闭在魁北克省的所有仓库，裁员 1,900 人
item.description: 亚马逊公司将关闭加拿大法语区魁北克省的所有仓库并裁员。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. will shut down all warehouses and lay off employees in the French-speaking Canadian province of Quebec.】

item.title: 英国皇家财务报告委员会称，英国 5 亿英镑农业税的收入将低于预期
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）在预算责任办公室（Office for Budget Responsibility）的一份分析报告中指出，从长远来看，由于家庭利用税收规划来规避遗产税，英国农场遗产税的征收可能会低于预期。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ extension of inheritance tax to UK farms may raise less than hoped in the longer term as families use tax planning to avoid the levy, according to an analysis by the Office for Budget Responsibility.】

item.title: 印度石油公司将在俄罗斯制裁后重新平衡原油采购
item.description: 由于美国对俄罗斯的新制裁影响了来自莫斯科的原油供应，印度石油公司的原油采购可能会发生变化，从而促使这个南亚国家最大的炼油商寻求替代品。【原文：Crude oil purchases by Indian Oil Corp. may shift as the new US sanctions on Russia affect supplies from Moscow, pushing the South Asian country’s biggest refiner to seek alternatives.】

item.title: 纳斯达克首席执行官推动新政府转变监管方式
item.description: 纳斯达克公司（Nasdaq Inc.首席执行官阿德娜-弗里德曼（Adena Friedman）说。【原文：The new Trump administration offers an opportunity to rework regulation in the US to make it more attractive for companies to tap public markets, Nasdaq Inc. Chief Executive Officer Adena Friedman said.】

item.title: 英伟达零日期权是 ETF 新贵的下一个大赌注
item.description: ETF 行业的后起之秀又一次掷出了新产品的骰子—；这一次，他把赌注押在了华尔街零日期权热潮的扩张上。【原文：The ETF industry’s upstart-in-chief is back with another roll of the new-product dice — this time betting on a game-changing expansion of Wall Street’s zero-day options boom.】

item.title: 深冻使美国最大电网的电力需求创下冬季纪录
item.description: 随着美国南部从 130 年来最严重的暴风雪中恢复过来，一场深度冰冻正在使整个美国东部的电力供应紧张，使美国最大电网的需求量达到冬季历史最高水平。【原文：A deep freeze is straining power supplies across the eastern US, sending demand on the country’s largest electric grid to an all-time winter high as the South digs out from one of the worst snow storms in 130 years.】

item.title: 土耳其财富基金考虑收购 LetterOne 持有的 Turkcell 股份
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，土耳其主权财富基金正在考虑收购LetterOne Holdings SA持有的Turkcell Iletisim Hizmetleri AS的少数股权，而LetterOne Holdings SA的部分股权由受到制裁的俄罗斯亿万富翁米哈伊尔-弗里德曼（Mikhail Fridman）和彼得-阿文（Petr Aven）持有。【原文：Turkey’s sovereign wealth fund is considering buying the minority stake in Turkcell Iletisim Hizmetleri AS held by LetterOne Holdings SA, which is partly-owned by sanctioned Russian billionaires Mikhail Fridman and Petr Aven, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 安哥拉计划在2025年发行多达20亿美元的欧洲债券
item.description: 安哥拉经济协调国务部长若泽-德利马-马萨诺说，安哥拉正寻求在今年筹集多达20亿美元的欧元债券，以延长到期日和降低债务成本。【原文：Angola is looking to raise as much as $2 billion in eurobonds this year as it works to extend maturities and lower the cost of its debt, Minister of State for Economic Coordination Jose de Lima Massano said.】

item.title: Venture Global 将首次公开募股价格区间下调 40% 以上
item.description: Venture Global Inc. 削减了其首次公开募股的市场范围，降低了其可能获得的市场价值。【原文：Venture Global Inc. slashed the marketed range for its initial public offering, lowering the market value it could fetch.】

item.title: 赞比亚克服 2024 年严重干旱，提高铜产量
item.description: 赞比亚矿业部长表示，赞比亚将在 2024 年提高铜产量，该行业已克服了去年曾危及产量的严重干旱。【原文：Zambia boosted its copper output in 2024, according to the nation’s mines minister, with the industry overcoming a severe drought last year that had put production at risk.】

item.title: 卡塔尔希望欧盟重新研究影响液化天然气贸易的 ESG 规则
item.description: 卡塔尔财政部长表示，欧洲为与集团有贸易往来的大公司制定了严格的环境、社会和公司治理报告标准，这一规定造成了不公平竞争。【原文：A European regulation setting strict ESG-reporting standards for large companies trading with the bloc creates unfair competition, Qatar’s finance minister said.】

item.title: 雷恩表示欧洲央行有信心将通胀稳定在目标水平上
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员奥利-雷恩（Olli Rehn）表示，欧洲中央银行相信通胀率将稳定在 2% 的目标上，货币政策将在今年上半年停止限制性。【原文：The European Central Bank is confident inflation will stabilize at its 2% target and monetary policy will cease to be restrictive in the first half of this year, according to Governing Council member Olli Rehn.】

item.title: 印度在石油制裁后扩大对俄罗斯保险公司的批准范围
item.description: 印度扩大了对俄罗斯保险公司的支持，因为在美国本月早些时候实施新的制裁之后，莫斯科海运原油的最大买家正努力保持打折原油的供应。【原文：India widened backing for Russian insurers as the largest buyer of Moscow’s seaborne crude strives to keep discounted barrels flowing, after the US imposed fresh sanctions earlier this month.】

item.title: 胡塞武装称被囚禁一年多的船员已获释
item.description: 也门胡塞叛军说，他们已经释放了一年多前劫持的一艘商船上的船员，这是红海地区船只风险缓解的最新一步。【原文：Yemen’s Houthi rebels said they have released the crew of a commercial vessel that they hijacked over a year ago, the latest step in the easing of risks to ships in the Red Sea region.】

item.title: 欧洲央行降息计划在与特朗普回归的首次接触中幸存下来
item.description: 欧洲中央银行推进降息的计划经受住了唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫对美国经济政策的初期冲击。【原文：Plans by the European Central Bank to push ahead with interest-rate cuts are withstanding the early jolts in US economic policy driven by Donald Trump’s return to the White House.】

item.title: 议会老将贾比尔被提议担任黎巴嫩财政部长
item.description: 资深立法者、前经济部长亚辛-贾比尔（Yassine Jaber）已成为黎巴嫩下一任财政部长职位的热门候选人，这是黎巴嫩寻求经济改革和完成拖延已久的债务重组的关键职位。【原文：Veteran lawmaker and former economy minister Yassine Jaber has emerged as a frontrunner for the job of Lebanon’s next finance minister, a key post as the country seeks to reform its economy and complete a long-delayed debt restructuring.】

item.title: 欧盟认为将与特朗普达成协议并就技术问题展开争论
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在上任后的第一周就大肆发出关税威胁，包括欧盟在内的各国政府正严阵以待，以防他的强硬言论演变成一场真正的贸易战。【原文：As President Donald Trump slings tariff threats far and wide during his first week back in office, governments including the European Union are bracing for his tough talk to descend into an actual trade war with the US.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率降至 7.02%，六周来首次下降

item.title: 波兰工业产出和工资数据为降息提供依据
item.description: 波兰 12 月份的工业生产和工资增长均未达到分析师的预期，从而引发了对该国经济反弹预期的质疑，并给波兰央行降低借贷成本带来了更大的压力。【原文：Poland’s industrial production and wage growth both missed analyst forecasts in December, raising questions about the country’s expected economic rebound and piling more pressure on the central bank to reduce borrowing costs.】

item.title: 特朗普重提关税威胁，中国股市受到冲击
item.description: 昨天，特朗普仍在考虑征收 10%关税的最新言论戳破了人们对其对华态度的一丝乐观。诚然，这并不像他之前所说的征收 60% 的关税那么糟糕。但这足以导致投资者抛售亚洲股票。沪深300指数五天来首次下挫，而在香港，恒生中国企业指数下跌2%，成为该地区表现最差的股票。人民币领跌亚洲新兴货币。【原文：The dash of optimism yesterday about Trump’s approach to China has been punctured by the latest comment that he’s still considering 10% tariffs. The CSI 300 Index sank for the first time in five days, while in Hong Kong, the Hang Seng China Enterprises Index lost 2% to be the worst performer in the region. The yuan led declines in emerging Asian currencies.The backdrop for Chi】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯大力吸引游客吸引更多外国游客
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯表示，去年接待了创纪录的 3000 万外国游客，因为沙特斥巨资建设酒店、豪华项目和娱乐设施，以将自己打造成一个旅游中心。【原文：Saudi Arabia said it received a record 30 million foreign tourists last year as the kingdom spends heavily on hotels, luxury projects and entertainment to transform itself into a hub for tourism.】

item.title: 瑞银集团首席执行官警告决策者不要忽视高债务水平的风险
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）首席执行官塞尔吉奥-埃尔莫蒂（Sergio Ermotti）周三在世界经济论坛（World Economic Forum）上对与会者说，决策者在试图预测下一场金融危机时，应该花更多的时间考虑政府债务高企的问题，而不是模糊不清的市场风险。【原文：Policymakers trying to predict the next financial crisis should spend more time thinking about high levels of government debt than obscure market risks, Sergio Ermotti, Chief Executive Officer of UBS Group AG, told an audience at the World Economic Forum on Wednesday.】
